Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Simran Jeet Singh serves as a spiritual leader at The Sikh Coalition located at 50 Broad Street #504, New York, NY 10004.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Simran Jeet Singh serving as a spiritual leader at The Sikh Coalition located at 50 Broad Street # 504, New York, NY 10004.

Council Member Chin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Land Use Call-Ups

By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca, Jr.)
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on related Application No. C 200094 ZSK (312 Coney Island Avenue) shall be subject to Council review.  This item is related to Application Nos. C 200092 ZMK and N 200093 ZRK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 312 Coney Island Avenue Rezoning, Brooklyn (C 200092 ZMK, N 200093 ZRK and C 200094 ZSK)

Items.MatterName: Prohibit property owners and loan service agencies from negatively impacting credit scores of businesses, property owners or renters for nonpayment due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Legislation that would add, at minimum, a six month extension to the back end of a lease or mortgage that would not penalize or create a balloon payment to the arrears that were accumulated during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Items.Title: Resolution amending Rule 7.00 of the Rules of the Council in relation to changes in membership to the Standing Committees of the Council and the Land Use Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Changes in membership to the Standing Committees of the Council and the Land Use Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises.

Items.Title: Resolution amending Rule 7.00 of the Rules of the Council in relation to dissolving the Committee on the Justice System and transferring its jurisdiction to the Standing Committees on Public Safety and General Welfare.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Dissolving the Committee on the Justice System and transferring its jurisdiction to the Standing Committees on Public Safety and General Welfare.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 45 Council Members marked present at this virtual Stated Meeting.

At the time of this Stated Meeting, there were three vacant seats on the Council:
37th District (Brooklyn), 12th District (The Bronx), and 24th District (Queens).

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Council Members Cabrera and Ulrich are considered Present but Not Voting for the LU Call-up vote.

Items.Title: Application No. 20215006 HAM (505 West 134th Street Cluster) submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to Article 16 of the General Municipal Law and Article XI of the Private Housing Finance Law, requesting the waiver of the area designation requirements of Section 693 of the General Municipal Law and Sections 197-c and 197-d of the Charter, approval of an urban development action area project, and approval of an exemption from real property taxes for property located at 505 West 134th Street (Block 1988, Lot 27), 523 West 134th Street (Block 1988, Lot 12), and 527 West 134th Street (Block 1988, Lot 8), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 9.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 505 West 134th Street Cluster, Manhattan (20215006)

Items.Title: Communication from the Kings County Democratic Committee recommending the name of Rodney L. Pepe-Souvenir to the Council regarding her appointment to the office of Commissioner of Elections of the Board of Elections pursuant to § 3-204 (4) of the New York State Election Law.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Rodney L. Pepe-Souvenir, Office of Commissioner of Elections of the Board of Elections.

Items.Title: Application No. C 200103 ZMQ (110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning) submitted by Tuchman Associates, LLC, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 10b, changing from an R6B District to an R6 District, Borough of Queens, Council District 21, Community District 4.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application No. N 200104 ZRQ (110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning) submitted by Tuchman Associates, LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying Appendix F for the purpose of establishing a Mandatory Inclusionary Housing area, Borough of Queens, Council District 21, Community District 4.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 110-40 Saultell Avenue Rezoning, Queens (N 200104 ZRQ)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned the virtual proceedings.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
